keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
keywords.name: subject

lead_paragraph: Harry Wu, who spent 19 years in Chinese labor camps, secured a grant from Yahoo to aid families of persecuted dissidents, but very little of it went to them.

headline.print_headline: Champion of Human Rights in China Leaves Tainted Legacy Over Finances
headline.main: Champion of Human Rights in China Leaves a Tarnished Legacy

snippet: Harry Wu, who spent 19 years in Chinese labor camps, secured a grant from Yahoo to aid families of persecuted dissidents, but very little of it went to them....
abstract: Harry Wu, prominent Chinese dissident and human rights advocate who died in April 2016, is accused of mishandling funds meant to aid families of dissidents in China; received $17 million grant from Yahoo, which hoped to make amends for helping Chinese authorities find activists who used its email service, but used most of money to support his nonprofit Laogai Research Foundation.
